IOGは、分散型アイデンティティツールのスイートであるAtala PRISMをHyperledger Foundationに提供しました。これはOpen Enterprise Agentとして構築され、W3C標準とHyperledger Aries RFCsに準拠しています。ブロックチェーン非依存を目指し、オープンソースでの開発とコミュニティ参加を重視しています。

主な特徴には、言語の柔軟性のためのREST API、Cardanoブロックチェーンとの統合、クラウドベースの設計、JVMの互換性、様々なクレデンシャルタイプのサポート、DIDCommプロトコルのサポートが含まれています。このエージェントはデジタルアイデンティティの未来に向けて多機能なツールとして位置付けられています。

@Khelechy1337 @Ace_KYD Great. This is how it works in general. Though, I was expecting more information on how the key can be derived which is via the DiD document resolved from the DiD. 

I think in DiDcomm, both asymmetric and symmetric encryption can be used based on some factors.

@Ace_KYD A DIDcomm is basically the communication between two DIDs (Sender & receiver). Symmetric or asymmetric cryptography is implemented for data encryption. A DID can be resolved to a DID Document which holds the verification method and key used to decrypt the message by the receiver.
@Vic_anene @Ace_KYD So basically Issuers or message Authenticators make use of the public key to sign(encrypt) the DIDcomm messages and then the recipient decrypts with the private key pair
@Ace_KYD On a higher level, can you explain how asymmetric or symmetric cryptography is implemented in a DIDcomm

The first-ever Dynamic Credentials: Update your credentials with ease! 🆔

Previously, if your credentials needed to be updated, you couldn’t easily do it. You'd have to manually refresh them

To improve updates in credentials, the W3C introduced the Verifiable Credentials standard:
👉 https://t.co/dYA1gwkU61

Until now, no one had implemented this method, but Polygon ID is the first to deliver a solution. Now, your credentials can stay up-to-date without the hassle!

For Business: Use-Cases & Benefits
Credential providers can now create new business models by offering credentials that need to be updated frequently:

• Dynamic Data: easily update credentials that change frequently, such as credit scores
• Truly compliant KYC/AML: implement a seamless KYC/AML verification process, creating short lived credentials and checking on each update
• Refresh Paid services: charging for updating credentials, such as renewing your driver license

For Devs: Refresh Service⚠️
With our refresh service, expired credentials are automatically updated from the user's wallet!

Dynamic credentials keep user information up-to-date. Now, users can either refresh their credentials themselves when they expire or have them automatically refreshed during verification, if required

This implementation of Dynamics Credentials involves adding a new service to the issuer's system and using a refresh protocol in mobile apps and JavaScript SDKs

Documentation
📄Docs for issuers:
https://t.co/1G94bMNdU1
📄Docs for wallet providers:
https://t.co/DyLYRDHItS

🎥 https://t.co/f5JQ5ysidv

📣 Polygon ID Release 6: First-ever implementation of Dynamic Credentials 🆔

A pioneering step towards fixing identity!

Update your credentials easily with Dynamic Credentials. With Polygon ID Release 6, expired credentials can automatically be updated from the user's wallet

Release 6 is packed with additional features advancing the identity stack:

• Test your zkQuery with the new QueryBuilder
• Customize your credential designs
• Private Proof of Uniqueness (Beta)
• And much more!

This release isn't just an update; we are showing a full commitment for Polygon ID to become the most adopted digital identity ecosystem

Read more👇🧵

$ICP friends, Dominic recently mentioned that Internet Identity will soon have W3C credentials support.

Imagine you have a special digital ID card that proves who you are online without having to show all your personal information every time you need to prove your identity.

This is what Internet Identity with W3C credential support is like.

$ICP friends, Dominic recently mentioned that Internet Identity will soon have W3C credentials support.

This is a bigger deal than you might think, so let me explain why this is extremely bullish news!

1/7 👇 https://t.co/Cb9ZaTiXW5

3/ Initiated by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) in 2017, the Verifiable Credentials Data Model offers a framework for creating and verifying digital credentials. This innovation paves the way for a more secure and interoperable digital world. 🔒🌐 #VCs https://t.co/ipl9alpBTC

Eventually digital verifiable credentials will fix this. Needing an authenticated key linked to an identity wallet, maybe having to post a stake of collateral, who knows how they will apply the technology yet, but it's all here now. 

W3C standards based protocols are spreading like wildfire for identity and credential utility. 

It's worth you looking into and and bringing on some guests who can explain this to your audience.  The adoption curve of this is going to come even faster than bitcoin.

@dominic_w @zeropassio DFINITY will release a toolkit that nobody cares about or needs. Verifiable W3C credentials are a useless feature that adds no value to the Internet Computer or its users. OpenChat is a ghost town that nobody uses or trusts.

@zeropassio DFINITY will release a toolkit that allows independent orgs to add verifiable W3C credentials to IIs. Examples:

– Authorize user to access private DFINITY community on OpenChat

– KYC/AML for security token market

Could/should incorporate ICAO (e.g. self-auth from passport) too
@itsmejeremy77 W3C defined an open standard for verifiable credentials, and Internet Identity is about to add support

Apparently $Cheq is a scam [according to some $ID people] because it builds upon W3C open standards, like Decentralised Identifiers and Verifiable Credentials.

DID：
OK

デジタル証明書：
名前、年齢、資産の所有権などの法的証拠を提供する検証済み資格情報 (VC) と呼ばれる安全なデジタル証明書

DWN：

The proposed solution consists of 3 pieces:

• Decentralized Identifier (DID)
→ digital identities that you own

• Decentralized Web Node (DWN)
→ data storage and relay mechanism that your DID controls

• Verifiable Credential (VC)
→ certificates that are verifiable https://t.co/5mfPfWMqCu
